meanings.definition: A unit of computing speed equal to one billion floating-point operations per second.
meanings.sent1: The supercomputer can process data at a rate of one gigaflop.
meanings.sent2: Scientists measure the computer's performance in gigaflops.
meanings.sent3: I wish I could think as fast as a gigaflop when taking tests!
meanings.sent4: Her mind raced like a gigaflop, solving problems in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The gigaflop speed of the machine left everyone amazed.

meanings.definition: The ability to perform one billion floating-point operations per second.
meanings.sent1: The new processor boasts impressive gigaflop capabilities.
meanings.sent2: Programmers aim to enhance the gigaflop capacity of the system.
meanings.sent3: I dream of having gigaflop brainpower to finish my work quickly.
meanings.sent4: His reflexes were as quick as a gigaflop, catching the ball effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The gigaflop potential of the device promises faster computations.
